list.title: FactoryFarm
list.description: A class to create and use factories

list.title: MockServer
list.description:
Sets properties needed internally

  • factoryFarm: a pre-existing factory to use on this server
  • responseOverrides: An array of alternative responses that can be used to override the ones that would be served from the internal store.

list.title: Model
list.description:
• Sets the store and id.
  • Sets jsonapi reference to relationships as a hash.
  • Makes the predefined getters, setters and attributes observable
  • Initializes relationships and sets attributes
  • Takes a snapshot of the initial state

list.title: RelatedRecordsArray
list.description: Extends an array to create an enhanced array.

list.title: Store
list.description: Initializer for Store class

list.title: QueryString
list.description: An object with default parse and stringify functions from qs

list.title: addIncluded
list.description: JSONAPI uses included only at the top level. To recursively add models to this array, we preserve the top-level object and pass it in to the next round Because objects can have multiple relationships, we do a check of the array to make sure it's not already there.

list.title: addRelatedRecord
list.description: Adds a record to a related array and updates the jsonapi reference in the relationships

list.title: circularFetchError
list.description: Will throw an error if fetch is called from the mockServer, usually due to a POST or PATCH called by a save

list.title: circularFindError
list.description: Throws an error if MockServer tries to findOne or findAll from itself.

list.title: coerceDataToExistingRecord
list.description: Takes any object with { id, type } properties and gets an object from the store with that structure. Useful for allowing objects to be serialized in real time, saving overhead, while at the same time always returning an object of the same type.

list.title: combineRacedRequests
list.description: Avoids making racing requests by blocking a request if an identical one is already in-flight. Blocked requests will be resolved when the initial request resolves by cloning the response.

list.title: defineToManyRelationships
list.description:
Takes the toMany definitions from a document type and creates getters and setters. A getter finds records from the store, falling back to a lookup of the inverse records if none are defined in the relationships hash.

The setter will unset the previous inverse and set the current inverse. Both return a RelatedRecordsArray, which is an array with added methods add, remove, and replace

A definition will look like this:

categories: { direction: 'toMany', inverse: { name: 'organization', direction: 'toOne' } }

list.title: defineToOneRelationships
list.description:
Takes the toOne definitions from a document type and creates getters and setters. A getter finds a record from the store. The setter calls setRelatedRecord, which will return an instance of a model and add it to the inverse relationship if necessary. A definition will look something like this:

todo: { direction: 'toOne', inverse: { name: 'notes', direction: 'toMany' } }

list.title: deriveIdQueryStrings
list.description: Splits an array of ids into a series of strings that can be used to form queries that conform to a max length of URL_MAX_LENGTH. This is to prevent 414 errors.

list.title: diff
list.description: deeply compare objects a and b and return object paths for attributes which differ. it is important to note that this comparison is biased toward object a. object a is walked and compared against values in object b. if a property exists in object b, but not in object a, it will not be counted as a difference.

list.title: disallowFetches
list.description: Overrides store methods that could trigger a fetch to throw errors. MockServer should only provide data for fetches, never call a fetch itself.

list.title: getOneFromFactory
list.description: Finds or creates a model that will match an id. This is useful for creating a response on the fly if no object already exists

list.title: makeDate
list.description: convert a value into a date, pass Date or Moment instances thru untouched

list.title: parseErrorPointer
list.description:
Parses the pointer of the error to retrieve the index of the record the error belongs to and the full path to the attribute which will serve as the key for the error.

If there is no parsed index, then assume the payload was for a single record and default to 0.

ex. error = { detail: "Foo can't be blank", source: { pointer: '/data/1/attributes/options/foo' }, title: 'Invalid foo' }

parsePointer(error)

{ index: 1, key: 'options.foo' }

list.title: parseErrors
list.description:
Parses JSONAPI error objects from a fetch response. If the response's body is undefined or is not formatted with a top-level errors key containing an array of errors, it builds a JSONAPI error object from the response status and a errorMessages configuration.

Errors that are returned which contain a status also have their detail overridden with values from this configuration.

list.title: removeRelatedRecord
list.description: Removes a record from an array of related records, removing both the object and the reference.

list.title: requestUrl
list.description: Build request url from base url, endpoint, query params, and ids.

list.title: serverResponse
list.description: Encodes models into full compliant JSONAPI payload, as if it were being sent with all relevant relationships and inclusions. The resulting payload will look like { data: { id: '1', type: 'zones', attributes: {}, relationships: {}, }, included: [] }

list.title: setRelatedRecord
list.description: Sets a related record, as well as the inverse. Can also remove the record from a relationship.

list.title: simulatePatch
list.description: Interpret a PATCH request

list.title: simulatePost
list.description: Interpret a POST request

list.title: singularizeType
list.description: Singularizes record type

list.title: stringifyIds
list.description: Coerces all ids to strings

list.title: validatePresence
list.description: returns true as long as the value is not null, undefined, or ''

list.title: validateProperties
list.description: Maps the passed-in property names through and runs validations against those properties

list.title: walk
list.description: recursively walk an object and call the iteratee function for each property. returns an array of results of calls to the iteratee.

list.title: wrapResponse
list.description: Wraps response JSON or object in a Response object that is itself wrapped in a resolved Promise. If no status is given then it will fill in a default based on the method.
